body_html:
I'm also getting this error on Windows 10 for Tensorflow GPU 1.4.0 version:

Tensorflow version is correct:

>pip show tensorflow-gpu
Name: tensorflow-gpu
Version: 1.4.0

Python/Anaconda versions are correct:

>conda info
conda version : 4.4.3
python version : 3.5.0.final.0

cuDNN64_6.dll exists:

>where cudnn64_6.dll
C:\Program Files\cuDNN6\cuda\bin\cudnn64_6.dll

NVidia CUDA 8.0 is installed.

I also have full Visual Studio 2015 as well as 2017 with C++ installed (so all runtimes are included).

So everything looks good and still I'm getting:

ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.

body:
I'm also getting this error on Windows 10 for Tensorflow GPU 1.4.0 version:

Tensorflow version is correct:
```
>pip show tensorflow-gpu
Name: tensorflow-gpu
Version: 1.4.0
```

Python/Anaconda versions are correct:
```
>conda info
conda version : 4.4.3
python version : 3.5.0.final.0
```

cuDNN64_6.dll exists:
```
>where cudnn64_6.dll
C:\Program Files\cuDNN6\cuda\bin\cudnn64_6.dll
```

NVidia CUDA 8.0 is installed.

I also have full Visual Studio 2015 as well as 2017 with C++ installed (so all runtimes are included).

So everything looks good and still I'm getting:
```
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.
```
